summary.p: 59 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 29; Qurʾānic Text: Q 61:7-66:10; 5 lines per page; Dimensions: 272 x 182mm; Script style: kūfī D.I / D.III.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Marcel 29
59 fol. 182×272 мм (1.5). Support: thin transparent parchment of yellowish color with traces of polishing. Writing material: brown ink.
Collation:
I: H1F H2F S H3F H4F S H5F / F6H S F7H F8H F9H S F10H;
II: H11F H12F S H13F H14F S H15F / F16H S F17H F18H F19H S F20H;
III: H21F H22F H23F H24F S H25F / F26H F27H S F28H F29H F30H;
IV: H31F S H32F S H33F H34F S H35F / F36H S F37H F38H F39H S F40H S;
V: H41F H42F S H43F S H44F S H45F / F46H S F47H S F48H S F49H F50H;
VI: H51F H52F S H53F S H54F S H55F / S F56H S F57H S F58H S F59H (fol. 51– once was part of bifolium with the second half lost).
Text layout: 84×168 мм (2.0), 5 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: D I or D III. Diacritics: occasional diagonal dashes (mostly under the letter yā). Vocalization: red and blue round dots.

Verse markers: for individual verses – rosettes (type 3.1.2) in gold and colors; for groups of five verses – medallions on the margins (type 3.B.II) in gold, green and red with the inscribed word خمس, accompanied on fol. 11r with the letter ﻪ (hā) in gold outlined with red paint; for groups of ten verses – medallions in the text line (type 3.B.II) in gold, red and green, with the inscribed word عشر.

Surah titles are inscribed in ornamented panels drawn in gold and red paint with large palmettos in the outer margins painted in gold and colors, outlined with blue paint: surah 62 – الجمعة احدى عشرة (fol. 7r); surah 63 – المنافقون احدى عشرة (fol. 15v); surah 64 – التغابن ثمان عشرة(fol. 25r); surah 65 – الطلاق اثنا عشرة اية(fol. 37r); surah 66 – التحريم اثنا عشرة(fol. 50r).

Inscriptions: in the upper outer corners of all sheets surah numbers in Roman numerals are inscribed; numbers of some verses are marked in Arabic numerals, in brown ink in the text and in pencil on the margins.
Stitching: threads are preserved in the punctures of the fold; on the outer folds of quires there are traces of brown substance (leather?).

Defects: many sheets have stains along the fold; upper and lower corners on the spine side are damaged probably by rodents; parchment destruction caused by aggressive ink on fol. 1; ink has peeled off on the flesh sides of some sheets.

Attached materials: old wrapping (fol. I) consisting of a narrow strip of paper inscribed with letters “J”, brief description of the manuscript in French in brown ink – “60 fts. 5 lig. / Sourate LXI v. 7 a fin / LXVII, LXIII, LXIV, LXV complets / LXVI v 1 à 10. / [...?]” and old accession number in red pencil “В. 7”; a sheet of paper with the description of the manuscript in J.-J. Marcel’s hand in brown ink, “Ce fragment conténant depuis le n° 1 / page 505 jusquau 2 page 514. / onytrouve ...???” .
Old accession numbers: J (on the wrapping), B. 7 (on the wrapping and according to Langlois’ inventory).
Contents:
Fol. 1r-7r. Surah 61, verses 7(7) – 14(14)*. Incipit: [ممّن افترى] على الله الكَذِبَ.
Fol. 7r-15v. Surah 62.
Fol. 15v-24r. Surah 63.
Fol. 25r-37r. Surah 64.
Fol. 37r-50r. Surah 65.
Fol. 50r-59v. Surah 66, verses 1(1)-10(10). Explicit: غنيا عنهما [من الله شيئاً] ."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
